result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Rowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M Rowe

defendant.name: Rowe, Anthony M
defendant.address: 100 Corrections Dr, c/o Stanley Correctional Institution, Stanley, WI 54768

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM - case called.  Defendant Anthony M Rowe in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Daniel Johnson appeared by video for Anthony M Rowe.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Johnson/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Johnson/Defendant.  Plea to Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant acknowledges the restrictions that go along with a felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Ellis/Atty Johnson/Defendant/Court regarding sentencing.  Court orders 40 months to the Wisconsin State Prison System consisting of 16 months initial confinement followed by 24 months extended supervision - consecutive to any other sentence - conditions of extended supervision being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages and cc/sc.  Sentence credit TBD.  Court grants the request to have the cellphone returned.  Court finds the Defendant is eligible for programming.  Post conviction rights given.
